sentence.Network_en: Adolescent suicide is rarely an impulsive reaction to immediate distress.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from react + -ion, originally suggested by medieval Latin reactio(n-), from react- 'done again' (see react)

entry.def: Your reaction to something that has happened or something that you have experienced is what you feel, say, or do because of it.

example.ex: Reaction to the visit is mixed...
example.tran: 对这次访问的反应不一。

example.ex: The initial reaction of most participants is fear...
example.tran: 多数参与者的最初反应是恐惧。

entry.def: A reaction against something is a way of behaving or doing something that is deliberately different from what has been done before.

example.ex: All new fashion starts out as a reaction against existing convention...
example.tran: 所有新时尚都是从打破现有常规开始的。

example.ex: Her three years of freedom seemed like a reaction against that childhood.
example.tran: 她那3年的自由仿佛是对孩童时代的反叛。

entry.def: If there is a reaction against something, it becomes unpopular.

example.ex: Premature moves in this respect might well provoke a reaction against the reform...
example.tran: 在这方面不成熟的举动很可能引发对改革的抵触情绪。

example.ex: The government response seems to be the result of strong public reaction against the police apathy.
example.tran: 政府的回应似乎是公众强烈抵制警察冷漠执法的结果。

entry.def: Your reactions are your ability to move quickly in response to something, for example when you are in danger.

example.ex: If his reactions are so slow, he shouldn't be in charge of a bus...
example.tran: 如果他的反应太慢，就不应该开公交汽车。

example.ex: The sport requires very fast reactions.
example.tran: 这项运动要求极快的反应力。

entry.def: Reaction is the belief that the political or social system of your country should not change.

example.ex: Thus, he aided reaction and thwarted progress.
example.tran: 因此，他帮助反动派阻挠进步。

example.ex: ...their victory against the forces of reaction and censorship.
example.tran: 他们取得的对保守势力和审查制度的胜利

entry.def: A chemical reaction is a process in which two substances combine together chemically to form another substance.

example.ex: Ozone is produced by the reaction between oxygen and ultraviolet light...
example.tran: 臭氧由氧气和紫外线发生反应而产生。

example.ex: Catalysts are materials which greatly speed up chemical reactions.
example.tran: 催化剂是可以大大加速化学反应的物质。

entry.def: If you have a reaction to a substance such as a drug, or to something you have touched, you are affected unpleasantly or made ill by it.

example.ex: Every year, 5000 people have life-threatening reactions to anaesthetics...
example.tran: 每年有5,000人对麻醉剂产生致命反应。

example.ex: Common foods which cause this kind of reaction are fish, eggs, and shellfish.
example.tran: 引发这种不良反应的常见食物包括鱼、蛋和贝类。

means.word_mean: 1. a response that reveals a person's feelings or attitude;

sentences.sentence: "he was pleased by the audience's reaction to his performance"
"John feared his mother's reaction when she saw the broken lamp"

means.word_mean: 2. a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent;
3. (chemistry) a process in which one or more substances are changed into others;

sentences.sentence: "there was a chemical reaction of the lime with the ground water"

means.word_mean: 4. an idea evoked by some experience;

sentences.sentence: "his reaction to the news was to start planning what to do"

means.word_mean: 5. doing something in opposition to another way of doing it that you don't like;

sentences.sentence: "his style of painting was a reaction against cubism"

means.word_mean: 6. extreme conservatism in political or social matters;

sentences.sentence: "the forces of reaction carried the election"

means.word_mean: 7. (mechanics) the equal and opposite force that is produced when any force is applied to a body;

sentences.sentence: "every action has an equal and opposite reaction"

auth_sentence.content: The unique reaction to her death will be preserved.
auth_sentence.res_content: The unique reaction to her death will be preserved.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The unique reaction to her death will be preserved.

auth_sentence.content: I just laughed; that was my first reaction.
auth_sentence.res_content: I just laughed; that was my first reaction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I just laughed; that was my first reaction.

auth_sentence.content: What we can change is our reaction to it.
auth_sentence.res_content: What we can change is our reaction to it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What we can change is our reaction to it.

exact[v.强求;精确的]+ing……的→adj.苛求的

act行动,活动,做+ivity特性→活动
in不+activity活跃→n.不活跃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 反应, 反作用, 反动[力]

react反应+or物器→n.反应堆
act行动,活动,做→v.行动,行为,扮演 n.[戏]幕
act行动,活动,做+ivate使→使……活动
actual实际的+ize化→实际化→实现
counter反+act行动,活动,做→反着动→力量对抗→抵消
en使+act行动,活动,做→使[法律]动→实施法律
ex出+act行动,活动,做→[要求]做出来→强求
inter相互+act行动,活动,做→相互动→相互作用
re反+act行动,活动,做→反动;反应
trans横+act行动,活动,做→横向动→互相贸易或交易

Sentence.sentence: But the message that everyone must screen for cancer has become so deep-rooted that when health care experts recommended that women under 50 and over 74 stop screening for breast cancer, it caused a riotous reaction among doctors, patients and advocacy groups.

The reaction to his death, with people leaving candles and flowers outside Apple stores and politicians singing praises on the internet, is proof that Mr Jobs had become something much more significant than just a clever money-maker

This is the process whereby helpers provide reassurance to clients that what they are experiencing is not abnormal or atypical（非典型的）, but is a normal reaction shared by others when facing such circumstances.
Furthermore, by gauging the reactions to our self-disclosures we learn what types are acceptable or unacceptable with particular people and in specific situations.
Your gut reaction (本能反应) and dismissive rejection, even of a worthless idea, might not qualify as systematic or fair.

sentences.en: Their reaction to the joke is to laugh.
sentences.cn: 他们对这个笑话的反应是笑。

jushi.english: Their reaction to the joke is to laugh.
jushi.chinese: 他们对这个笑话的反应是笑。

jushi.english: The popularity of these old-fashioned views reflects a reaction against the permissiveness of the 1960s.
jushi.chinese: 这种旧式观念的流行是反对60年代性开放的一种反应。
作用力与反作用力是相等的。
